Public Remarks: The bridge across the Halfway River has long been washed out but you can still follow the little used Old Cypress Creek road. At the end of it is nearly 600 acres of pristine wilderness little changed from when the first homesteaders found their way into the valley. Covered in large stand of fir and spruce, dotted with meadows all along the banks of fast flowing Halfway River it has the feel of a national park. Signs of wildlife abound and the big bends in the river offer up some fantastic fishing.. A short walk from the cabins will take you to a ridge top view of the sprawling Halfway River valley and all its beauty. Private land such as this come up very rarely in this area, call or email for more information.
